questions.question_text: Which three commands can be used to verify the integrity of Oracle Clusterware 12c OCR and OLR files? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
I agree A,C, E
 Logical corruption verification will be skipped if the preceding command is executed as a nonprivileged user.
To view the OCR file name and path, use the following command:
# ocrcheck -config 
http://what-when-how.com/Tutorial/topic-108718ku082/Expert-Oracle-RAC-12c-238.html

choices.C: a network interface for private interconnect only
choices.B: a network interface for ASM and private interconnect traffic
choices.D: a network interface for the public network
choices.E: a Grid Management Cluster Health Management (CHM) application server

discussion.content: A,C are not correct, correct answers are B,D

questions.question_text:
You are installing Oracle Grid Infrastructure 12c and configuring a Flex Cluster?
Which two elements are required to support this configuration? (Choose two.)
Which three statements are true concerning the behavior of an Oracle Clusterware 12c Flex Cluster in response to hub or leaf node failures? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Cluster Resources on a leaf node that is evicted from a Flex Cluster are relocated, if possible, to another leaf node that is connected to same hub node to which the failed leaf node was connected.
choices.F: Cluster Resources on a hub node that is evicted from a Flex Cluster are always relocated to a leaf node that was connected to the evicted hub node.
choices.D: Hub node eviction results in the eviction of all leaf nodes that were connected to the evicted hub node.
choices.C: Hub nodes evicted from a Flex Cluster always require a reboot.
choices.B: Hug node eviction results in the reboot of all leaf nodes that were connected to the evicted hub node.
choices.A: Leaf nodes evicted from a Flex Cluster always require a reboot.
choices.G: Cluster Resources on a hub node that is evicted from a Flex Cluster are always relocated to another hub node in the cluster.

choices.E: The maximum value of ASM_POWER_LIMIT is 1024.
choices.B: ASM_POWER_LIMIT controls the number of RDBMS instances that can access a disk group while it is being rebalanced.
choices.D: The default value of INSTANT_TYPE is ASM.
choices.A: A change to ASM_DISKSTRING requires a restart of all ASM instances for the change to take effect.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about initialization parameters for Clustered ASM instances?
questions.answer_description:
C: The default value of the ASM_DISKGROUPS parameter is a NULL string. If the parameter value is NULL or is not specified, then ASM does not mount any disk groups.
E: The ASM_POWER_LIMIT initialization parameter specifies the default power for disk rebalancing in a disk group. The range of values is 0 to 1024.
Incorrect Answers:
B: The ASM_POWER_LIMIT initialization parameter specifies the default power for disk rebalancing in a disk group. The range of values is 0 to 1024.
D: The default value of INSTANT_TYPE is RDBMS.
Reference:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/server.112/e18951/asminst.htm#BHCEHJGA

questions.question_text:
Examine this command:
SQL> CREATE DISKROUP data NORMAL REDANDUNCY:

FAILGROUP fgrpl DISK -
/dev/disk1 NAME disk1,
/dev/disk2 NAME disk2,
/dev/disk3 NAME disk3,

FAILGROUP fgrpl2 DISK -
/dev/disk4 NAME disk4,
/dev/disk5 NAME disk5,
/dev/disk6 NAME disk6,

FAILGROUP fgrpl3 DISK -
/dev/disk7 NAME disk7,
/dev/disk8 NAME disk8,
/dev/disk9 NAME disk9,
ATTRIBUTE au_size=4M,
compatible.asm = 11.2,
compatible.rdbms = 11.2,
compatible.advm = 11.2,
content_type = recovery;
Which two statements a true about this disk group, created using Grid Infrastructure 12.1?

choices.A: Each disk in each of the three fail groups is a mirror of the corresponding disk of the other two failure groups.
choices.D: Any database instance with the COMPATIBLE parameter set to 11.2 or higher can access it.
choices.C: It can contain ASM Dynamic Volume Manager (ADVM) volumes.
choices.E: The ASM compatible attributes can be changed to 11.1 for this disk group.
choices.B: File created in this disk group always has two copies for each allocation unit: one primary and one secondary.
